name: Saga Lindström
core_wound: Lost a major architectural commission because she questioned a smart city surveillance proposal; learned to stay quiet and not make waves
wants: To feel safe and comfortable in her own home; to be proven right about the building's behavior
needs: To rediscover her courage to speak up against unjust systems, even at personal cost
voice_markers: Technical precision - uses architectural and systems terminology naturally
Self-questioning - 'Maybe I'm imagining it' / 'Am I being paranoid?'
Data-driven speech - cites specific examples and patterns
Dry humor when stressed - sarcastic observations about her situation
contradiction: Designs living spaces for a living but feels increasingly trapped in her own apartment; values systematic thinking but is being gaslit into doubting her observations
knowledge_state: Works from home in Turning Torso, floor 28
Uses keycard and PIN instead of biometrics (privacy concerns)
Experienced a lost commission due to ethical concerns about smart city tech

relationships.Erik_Månsson: Wary professional relationship - he dismisses her complaints
relationships.Aisha_Osman: Neighborly but growing tension over biometric divide
relationships.Lena_Holmqvist: Not yet met - will become crucial ally

physical_description: Tall, practical clothing, always carries a notebook for sketching, slight shadows under eyes from tracking data late into nights
background: Stockholm native, moved to Malmö for work-life balance; passionate about human-centered architecture; lives alone after breakup
skills: Basic data analysis and spreadsheet work
